dialogues.text: Good God... Good God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes on ADAM. He takes a while... Finally,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we get her out of here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A reasonable question. Boyd thinks. BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrap her up in blankets. Bring the  car around to the back of the hotel,  throw her off the balcony, put her  in the car... Done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) You don't think someone will have a  problem with a body being thrown off  a balcony?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We check out the area and wait for a  time when it's clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the blood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone goes to Walmart, gets some  buckets, brushes, mops, Spic and  Span, the works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever done this before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reality is, you take away the  horror of this situation, take away  the tragedy of the death, take away  the moral and ethical implications  of all the crap you have had  conditioned, beaten, into your head  since grade one. What are we left  with? What? A 115 lb. problem. 115  lbs. that must be moved from point A  to point B. Now, a straight line in  the shortest distance but we are  denied the luxury of a visible  straight line. But that line exists  and I see it. I see that line. Trust  me. Adam. Trust me... I can take  care of this.

dialogues.speaker: KNOCK KNOCK
dialogues.text: The five men stop breathing. Somebody's at the door.

dialogues.speaker: KNOCK KNOCK
dialogues.text: Stunned silence. The guys stare at each other in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Is anyone in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyd races to the door, eyes the peephole. BOYD'S POV, through the peephole, outside in the hall, a  man. RALPH, early 30's, fairly unassuming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls out) What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, yeah, hi. Is Tina there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam throws his head in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through door) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm with Tina. Is she there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyd indicates to the guys to be cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's here. She's just... Hold on a  second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyd turns as the guys freak. Crazed bits of panicked  conversation -- GIBBERISH. KNOCK KNOCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you open the door please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyd moves back to the door, slowly, opens it. Ralph step in. Takes a good look around. RALPH'S POV of the fairly destroyed hotel room and five  severely traumatized men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who's the lucky guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The groom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool... (beat) You all dudes from L.A.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doing the bachelor party thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sin City. Devil's Playground. The  Black Bitch. All day every day. (beat) Where's Tina?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's in the bathroom... she's still  working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's still working?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SILENCE. Ralph checks the rest of the guys. Some strange contact. Extremely uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Fine. Perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More SILENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating bathroom) I'm gonna just tell her I'm waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts for the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's in there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just gonna let her know I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Ralph is on his way to the bathroom. And the guys are freaking as Ralph moves through the bedroom up towards th bathroom. Hand on door -- opening door -- stepping in -- Ralph sees Tina. RALPH, in shock, staring, back-peddles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ralph starts to turn --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! NOOOO!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON BOYD -- his Boy Scout knife raised above his head --  driving it into Ralph's neck! MAJOR ARTERIAL SPRAY as Ralph's jugular is severed. Ralph struggles. Boyd wrestles him back toward the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me! Don't let him bleed on the  carpet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And MOORE is there. Helping Boyd wrestle the SCREAMING  thrashing Ralph into the bathroom. Ralph fights like a gi Marlin. They shove him into the bathroom. Boyd slams the  door shut. Holds it tight as Ralph tries to force it back open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll bleed out! He'll bleed dry.  Help me hold the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And help they do. Michael, Moore and Adam all hold the do shut as Ralph continues to fight for his life. Slowly the force of his POUNDING eases. We hear Ralph slowing down.. The thrashing slows... softer... The MOANS quiet... softe Just a slight GURGLE... Ralph is going... going... Ralph gone.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE DOOR
dialogues.text: Eight hands slowly peel off the bathroom door. Devastatin SILENCE as the guys attempt to process this, the latest o developments... with Fisher staring, blotto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door slowly opens. Boyd first -- then the rest of the guy's heads slowly appear in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Moore is out the door, racing for a garbage can to re himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An absolute blood bath. The walls are covered with Ralph' arterial spray. Tina lies, still dead on her side. Ralph somehow "assumed the position" dead, head in the bathtub. bizarre and gruesome sight. Boyd surveys the carnage, tak charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with military  precision) All right people. New plan. Not even  a new plan so much as a modification  of the old plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beyond shock) I'm calling the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So help me God you touch that phone  and I bury you with them. (beat) Surrender is no longer an option. I  repeat -- It is not an option. Is  there anyone who does not understand  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisher's response is to join Moore, as he searches for a  garbage can to puke in. Michael just stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little gut check time fellas. A  time for some serious self- exploration. How do I function? For  real? No more bullshit. Can I keep  my cool when they bounce my bananas?  When they won't play my fucking song?  etc, etc. Do you get me? Do you get  me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really. no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a problem. Understand not my  words, but follow my orders. Follow  my orders

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys move down the isles of the massive 24 hour every store, Boyd pushes a cart, grabbing; cleaning supplies, t tape, giant pruning shears, etc...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will organize, we will mobilize,  we will maximize and prioritize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moore grabs a plastic garbage can off a shelf and pukes i it for all he's worth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys attempt to look natural as they stroll through t casino with their supplies. Late night gamblers pay them  little notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyd turns up the MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's do it people.

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC OVER SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: Moore and Fisher scrub blood from the carpet. Fisher keep forgetting to breath. Michael and Boyd put Tina and Ralph in the bath tub. Adam sits in shock on the floor. Fisher and Moore try to fix a broken chair. Boyd starts to dismember Ralph with the pruning shears, l cutting the joints of a roasted chicken. Adam stares at the wall. Michael wraps one of Ralph's feet in plastic, puts it in suitcase. Boyd saws. Michael wraps. Fisher and Moore clean. Adam slowly straightens up a lamp, begins to help. UNTIL -- the last of the body parts, Tina's head, is wrap in plastic, packed in a suitcase. The bathroom has been remarkably cleaned up. Just a bit o blood left in the tub. Boyd looks pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Looking good people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The minivan bumps along a deserted road at a snail's pace

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam drives, cringing with every bump and bang. Everyone tense. Boyd eyes the clock. It's 4 a.m.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sun rises at 5:52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not wrecking the transmission!

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: The guys off-loading the suitcases. Fisher and Boyd digging holes. They start putting the suitcases in the holes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Wait a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've already done this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean the suitcases. We can't  bury them in suitcases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's sacrilegious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you figure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to Jewish law, the blood  and limbs are considered to be part  of the human being. They must be  buried together or their souls won't  rest in peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's what we're doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No we're not. The bodies are all  mixed up. We can't do this to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's Asian. They don't have Jews in  Asia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is absolutely not true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Well what the fuck are we supposed  to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as if reasonable) Open the suitcases, unpack the body  parts and reunite the limbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has to be done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to get going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not flexible on this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. Let's do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys start breaking down the body parts, ripping open cases...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the guys put limbs with bodies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dirt being thrown on top of the reunited bodies until the are all completely buried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the last of the dirt is packed down by Boyd. The guys  stare down at the grave site.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I am the last to say that we  have done here is a good thing. It's  not. It's not a good thing. But it  was, given the circumstances, the  smart play. We did what had to be  done. And... well... I'm proud of  us. I'm proud of each and every one  of us. We performed. Under the most  complex and nerve shattering of  situations, we stood fast and we  delivered. I feel proud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are all going straight to hell.  Either hell or prison, whichever  comes first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong. That is flat out wrong. hell  is for cowards, for hypocrites who  fear to live by the strength of their  own convictions. This is war. Given  the circumstances and given the fact  that we are alive and they are not,  we have chosen life over death. Two  wrongs don't make a right. So our  conviction and execution would only  mean more death here, not less.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyd... I don't know man... It just  seems to me that ever since you took  Tony Robbins self-help thing... you're  all fucked-up in the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got to agree with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is a load of shit. Personal  power has nothing to do with any of  this. Tony Robbins has helped me to  unlock energy and see my options  more clearly, yes, but to give him  credit for this, for all of this...  Well that's just more than the man  deserves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should say some words  over the grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of words?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talking about prayer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisher steps to the grave, looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear God... I don't know how to pray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just go ahead and say what's on your  mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speak from the heart my brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam turns in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is pathetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're pathetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning on Michael) What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) You're not a team player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't point at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never were a team player. That's  why you never had any friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have plenty of friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have acquaintances -- business  friends and superficial golf buddies.  You have always been a fringe player.  You have some serious male on male  intimacy problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you fucking talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael looks at Boyd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, now is probably not the  best time for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, this is the perfect time. This  is real time. Adam. Your brother and  I, as well as several others present,  have always suspected that you... (points to Adam) ...are a fully repressed, living in  major denial, locked down, fly-boy  butt-fucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEAD SILENCE. Adam stares stupefied at Boyd, then Michael Finally, Fisher says his prayer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear God, please forgive us for what  we have done here tonight. We have  lost our way. Speaking for myself,  let me say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisher's prayer over the guys driving home. Each lost in own thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I am deeply in love with the woman  I am about to marry and I look very  much forward to raising a family and  being a positive member of society.  We promise, if you forgive us, we  will never forget this tragedy and  will try with all our powers to use  it as a daily reminder that we are  here on earth to do good not evil.  Let us go from this day forward with  new purpose and spirit. You have  given us a second chance and let us  take that second chance and use it  as fuel to feed our fires of  productivity so that the spirits of  the two we now bury live on forever  in the good deeds and positive  achievements we from this moment on  shall make our life's work...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Continue as the minivan disappears down the freeway, head back to Los Angeles. A freeway sign reads, "Los Angeles, miles."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you lord, and again, we ask  for your forgiveness and guidance...  Amen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam watches his mini-van move through the wash and rinse cycle, staring, paranoid at the Mexican Towel Boy cleanin the interior. MICHAEL tries to open a child proof bottle of Excedrin. BOYD plays "Mrs. Pac-man" in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: MEN'S ROOM
dialogues.text: Moore dry heaves for all he's worth.

dialogues.speaker: PAY PHONE
dialogues.text: Fisher finishes dialing, waits... Finally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. It's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on our way home. I just...  we're running a little late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How late?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Just like an hour or so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the chairs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I left a message. I think it's going  to be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sound funny. Did you do cocaine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No. I'll see you in about four  hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he hangs up the phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distant; unheard) Do you love me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK. Fisher, in a daze, turns and walks into right into Adam who has been standing there listening. Adam doesn't  look so good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to hear me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and I have done nothing. You  especially. We are innocent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are. We go to the police. We tell  them the truth. Now. Before they  find out. Now. We save ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HISPANIC CAR WASH WORKER beeps the horn, Adam jumps. van is ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam stares daggers into Fisher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We save ourselves. It's our only  chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam heads back to the car, leaving Fisher alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shiny clean minivan cruises to a stop in front of the house. Adam Jr., "Little Adam," and Timmy play in the fen yard along with a couple of other kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam stops the car. The guys sit in silence as the kids  assault the truck, climbing all over it. Little Adam wave his crutches wildly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Daddy's home! Daddy's home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyd addresses the fellas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The past is the past. Today is the  beginning of the rest of our lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today is the best day of the rest of  our lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disgusted) The first day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Lois, with camera, and Liz, come out the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disgusted & depressed) It goes; "Today is the first day of  the rest of our lives."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: However it goes, the point is, nobody  says anything to anyone ever.  Right?... Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the little kids put their lips up to the windows, maki funny faces,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're goddamn right. Adam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam is silent, watching the beautiful chaos that is his  family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reluctant) Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the guys get out and are mauled by the hyper kids and  Lois and Liz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with camera) Group shot. Here we go boys! Yes  sir, compare and contrast time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts herding the boys into a group pose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feeling a little HUNGOVER are we? Do  you kids take note? (taking pictures) See how pathetic Daddy and his jackass  friends look?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisher makes eye contact with Liz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the word on the chairs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you'd better work on it in the  car. We gotta go see the Judge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't say "love, honor and obey"  anymore. And we don't say "till death  do us part." Today we say, "respect,  honor and cherish, as long as you  both do love." How does that sound?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kind of like "till death do us  part." I mean, this is forever. In  sickness and in health, through good  times and bad. Honey, what do you  think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz looks at Fisher who is a nuclear wreck, barely cohere

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yea... It's great... seems like... I  don't know you've got all the  important stuff in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right then. It's refreshing to  see two young people not afraid of  real commitment. Will you have friends  or family saying words -- singing or  anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Are we supposed to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a question of supposed to,  it's an entirely personal decision...  Some do some don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't think so. I mean, we just  want the singing when I come out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay great. What will that be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're just going to have the leader  of the band sing alone with his  guitar. Acoustic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What song?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "You Send Me."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I know that. How does it go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, (talks it) Darling you... you send me... Darling  you... You mend me. (to Fisher) Honey, sing it for Judge Tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In lieu of an anxiety attack, Fisher...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sings) "Darli...ing you, ewe ewe ewe, send  me, Darli...ing you, ewe ewe ewe,  mend me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "At first I thought it was  infatuation... But oh it's lasted so  long..." FISHER & LIZ "Now I find myself wanting to marry  you, marry you and take you home..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judge Tower joins in and the three squeak out the chorus it's pretty pathetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys are being fitted for their wedding tuxes. Lois takes pictures of the five groomsmen. Liz closely watches as the TAILOR makes adjustments to  Fisher's tux. Adam looks sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisher and his dad walk along the pier eating hot dogs. A father and son moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to just take this final  opportunity to visit with you. You  know, just to be with you, father  and son, before you run off and do  your own husband, daddy thing. (starts to choke-up) I'm just so goddamn proud of you...  God knows I didn't always play it  right with you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did all right dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could have done it better. I'm a  fucking ball-buster I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never walked away dad. You could  have walked away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just so scared of that song.  That fucking, "My son just arrived  the other day... he says thanks for  the ball, come on let's play. I got  lots of bills come again next day.  He's grown up just like me... My boy  is just like me." Gordon fucking  Lightfoot, Cat Stevens, whoever,  that song just fucking kills me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry Chaplin. "Cats in the Cradle."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just kills me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you so much it hurts. Me and  your mother marvel at what you have  become. You're going to have a  wonderful journey with this girl. I  feel it deep inside. A wonderful,  magical journey. (cries again) And I'm, like I said, just so proud  of how you turned out. (hugs Fisher)  You go out and knock 'em dead Keith.  Knock 'em dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Fisher we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON A Vegas Newspaper Metro Section slammed down on desk -- A small article on Tina, the now missing prostitu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you get that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the newsstand on 3rd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (falling apart) Fucking Boyd. That fucking idiot.  They're on to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not on to us. I'm gonna call  Boyd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON BOYD talking into cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh that's just nothing. That's just  a missing persons thing, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said nobody would miss her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I said nobody knew she was coming  to the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabs phone) Boyd you idiot, the shit's coming  down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got us into this mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I did? I think it was your little  rat fuck brother who decided to play  Hamburger Helper with the hooker's  head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (freaks) Would you, shush?! These phones aren't  secure!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lighten up Adam. Show some character.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk to me about character.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch the tone fella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisher realizes he's not breathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you Boyd!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any time fat boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyd hangs up the phone, looks at his picture on the real sign he just pounded into someone's yard. Behind the biza sincere smile we now see the eyes of a maniac. Boyd picks the sledge hammer and swings wildly, destroying his sign, splintering it into kindling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisher and Liz taste different samples of cake and compar different cake designs with a BAKER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surrounded by hundreds of different floral arrangements, shows a zombied Fisher the flowers she's picked for the  wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful country style beach house in Santa Monica. Li Fisher and the realtor, MAGGIE, walk into the charming  kitchen. Fisher seems stresses by the price tag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love it. I just love, love, love,  love it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you guys gonna fill this place  with kids? You sure got room for  them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in no hurry. I think we'll  take some time to enjoy each other,  enjoy our freedom before we surrender  ourselves to kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your time. I wish I had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hugs Fisher) We will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where to on the honeymoon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is our honeymoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the wedding, which we're paying  for ourselves, and this house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smart. Smart. Smart. Think big  picture, take your time. I wish I  had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's our plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I just need your signature on  these contracts and a deposit check  so I can get the ball rolling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz looks at Fisher. She really wants the house. He takes out his checkbook. Liz throws her arms around Fisher, kis him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five percent should be fine for now,  which is, let's see, twenty thousand  dollars. Of course I'll be splitting  my commission with your friend. (beat) He is a very sweet man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz stares at Fisher. His hand shakes as he writes the ch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam, Lois and the kids pull into the mini-mart, up to th gas pump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam, ghost white, fumbles for a credit card as the kids nuts in the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) "Do your balls hang low, do they  wobble to and fro, can you tie 'em  in a knot, can you tie 'em in a bow?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snapping) Knock it off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't snap at them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're driving me nuts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're singing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black sedan, looking like an unmarked police car, pulls nose-to-nose with them at the pump. TWO MEN in dark suits the front look like cops. Adam can't help but notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting out) It's a disgusting song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam slides his card through at the pump and starts filli his tank as one of the "suits" gets out of the black seda and does the same. Adam and the "suit" make eye-contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How ya doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous mumble) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said how's it going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't hear you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that's what I said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam nods, eyeing his gas pump, willing it to pump faster His heart starts to pound, he looks away, sees... An LAPD police car pull into the station, stops in front the mini-mart. TWO COPS inside. ON adam, eye-balling the cop car. He slowly turns to stea glance at the "suit."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you like that mini-van?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam's tank is almost filled. He wants nothing more than get out of there... Lois rolls down the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, go in there and get some  Starbursts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're screaming for Starbursts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're screaming like monsters and  it's giving me a headache. Go get  some fucking Starbursts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam looks from the suit to the cop car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACK with Adam as he walks from the pumping across the  parking lot, past the cop car, his HEART POUNDING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam quickly searches the candy section for Starburst. He looks out the window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "suit" has finished with the gas but he's not leaving He's taking a close look at Adam's van. He seems to be  checking the license plate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam is blocking the aisle. He doesn't notice a YOUNG   UNIFORMED COP trying to get past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam turns, panics, stumbles back, into the candy display and topples to the ground. ADAM lies flat on his back in monster mess of candy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam scrambles to his feet, trying frantically to fix the major mess -- only making it worse. The IRANIAN STORE CLE approaches, pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just leave it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (determined) It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Startled by his tone, Adam staggers back, into a Gatorade display, slips and topples to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GET OUT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on his back) I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They young cop gives Adam a hand up. Adam stare at the co

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tears in his eyes) I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GET OUT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam scurries out of the Mini-Mart, the Cop watches in  confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Adam races back to his car, the "Suit" moves in on him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wife's begging me for one. How's  the mileage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam jumps in the van, quickly starts it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the candy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no candy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? It's it's a goddamn  Mini-Mart?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam, in a cold sweat, hauls out of the Gas Station, pull into traffic, nearly gets hit, slams on the brakes, Lois  rockets FACE-FORWARD into the dashboard. FISHER & LIZ'S REHEARSAL DINNER - COCKTAIL RECEPTION

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: Fisher and Liz greet their guests. Moore smokes alone at the bar. Boyd and Michael charm a group of OLD LADIES. Adam arrives with his family, Adam Jr., Timmy and... Lois sporting a nose cast and two very black eyes. Boyd and Adam check each other out; hostile and suspiciou Adam takes Fisher aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you thought about what I said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Adam, can we not get into this  now please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a migraine like a little monkey  kicking in the side of my skull,  Mike Tyson with a fucking sledge  hammer trying to crack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cuts him off) I got you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dazed) Where's the bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: INT. REHEARSAL DINNER
dialogues.text: A large dining room in a Westside restaurant has been tak over by the wedding party. Seventy-five guests, dressed u are into the desserts. The toasts are about halfway over. MR. FISHER stands in the middle of the room with the larg blown-up pictures of Keith at different stages of his lif

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding picture of  Keith, age 4, on a  mule) And this is Keith at age four and  his best friend "Bunker the Mule."  Evidently, when they were in camp,  Keith and Boyd got into some serious  arguments over exactly who was Keith's  best friend -- Boyd or the mule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Fisher holds up a photo of a young Fisher and young B both scrappy and bloodied from a fist fight. Boyd sits with Moore at a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisher had a less than normal  relationship with that Donkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seated next to Liz) You always were a jealous man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Fisher holds up a picture of Keith, Boyd, Moore and  Michael all in a Peewee Football uniforms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After camp came football, and for  those of you not following the sports  pages back in 1977, you might not  remember the Peewee Powerhouse  Oklahoma, who, under the brilliant  leadership of your's truly, rolled  to an auspicious league record of 0- 12 scoring exactly zero touchdowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON Adam, looking extremely uncomfortable, surrounde by his family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The problem was coaching. Poor  leadership.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the room LAUGHS, Adam becomes visibly upset. Not keepi it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The problem was our quarterback had  trouble remembering his right from  left...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, the problem, as I recall, was  the lack of blocking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the guys debate, in front of the room, who's fault  Oklahoma's 0-12 season really was. TIGHT ON Adam. He's had enough, excuses himself from the  table. TIGHT ON Fisher, seeing Adam, he quietly excuses himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam stands by his car trying to compose himself. Fisher  approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't fucking breathe. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyd, followed by Michael exits the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (approaching) OK. Definitely not cool! Definitely  inappropriate behavior here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up Boyd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative. This is not what we have  worked out in terms of presented  behavior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's having a problem here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the problem Adam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moore joins the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes on Adam, who's eyes are starting to tear up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't do what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna get caught. I know we're  gonna get caught. They were eyeballing  my car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the seven-eleven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're on me. They're smoking me  out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts) Nobody's smoking anybody out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz is at the door of the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keith? Is everything okay, honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisher bolts over to Liz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah baby. Everything's great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, can you come back inside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not moving) Yeah. Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Look honey, I'll be right in.  I just... we're just taking care of  some Groomsmen last minute business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Fisher approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Dad. It's great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm in the middle of my goddamn  toast here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, OK. You guys just go back in.  Dad, keep going with the toast, we'll  be right in. Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisher ushers his father and Liz back inside, then turns, quickly head back to the parking lot where things are  escalating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on Adam) You got some mighty fucking fine bad  timing Adam. We got a rehearsal  situation here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give a damn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About anybody but yourself. You never  have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're a little fucking reject.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat my ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael kicks it again, harder. Adam shoves him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you ever touch my minivan again,  I'll make you sorry. Real sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a loser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the loser! A big black hole  sucking up everything you touch! YOU  MURDERED THAT GIRL! MURDERER!  MURDERER!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the loser! You think your  shit's so fucking righteous! FUCK  YOU! You were there with us, boy!  Right there! SIDE BY FUCKING SIDE!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut your fucking mouths!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyd and Fisher separate the brothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (freaking) I didn't do anything! I'll turn your  pathetic ass in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam! Calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't calm down. I can't do this.  We can't do this. It won't work. It  will not work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has worked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talking about DNA samples, fiber  optics, search parties, they got  infrared scanners, FBI scientists.  They figure this shit out. They always  figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got children. I've got a life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a retarded kid and a fat pig  wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking bastard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam attacks Michael, slashing, biting, mauling, the brot go down hard, slugging it out on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: EXT RESTAURANT
dialogues.text: Liz is back at the restaurant door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keith?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisher bolts over to Liz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's OK. Just some more  preparations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they fighting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No baby. We'll all be right in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisher pushes her inside and charges back to the...

dialogues.speaker: PARKING LOT
dialogues.text: Fisher helps break the fight. Adam and Michael try to con their rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is going to stop right now.  Right now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seething) You will not screw this up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you threaten me you little rat  fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you fucking threaten me --  I'll fucking kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyd pulls Michael to his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you just cool out. Go home  and go to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyd opens Michael's car door, puts him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just go home, chill the fuck out.  Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael starts his car. Boyd shuts the car door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MICHAEL, eyeballs Adam. Adam eyeballs him right back. Mic hits the gas and screeches away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Let's all go back in.  Adam? You're cool right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm not Boyd. I am not cool at  all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reluctantly, they start back in. A hundred or so feet away, Michael's car comes to an abru stop. They all turn. Michael turns his car around, idles a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael in a trance, staring at the guys watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Fucking Minivan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits the gas.

dialogues.speaker: EXT PARKING LOT
dialogues.text: Wheels spin, rubber burns. The guys watch as Michael spee full throttle, like a battering ram, right at Adam's belo minivan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOOOO!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam jumps between the minivan and Michael's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael's expression turns to horror. He slams on the bra but it's too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael's car crushes Adam like a sandwich meat between h car and the minivan. Metal, flesh, severed limbs, Adam  explodes like a gnat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaos. The room is filled with people from the Rehearsal  Dinner. Black-eyed, nose broken, LOIS sobs, surrounded by her kid and Liz. Boyd and Fisher talk to the POLICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was just a crazy freak accident.  He thought the car was in reverse...  He didn't realize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The COP takes notes. MICHAEL sits in a corner by himself. Ghost white. Trembli

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was there some sort of an argument?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Nothing like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We heard there was some arguing going  on. Some loud talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No. We were just all outside  just talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wedding. We were talking bout  how it was going to be one of the  last times for us to all be together  with Fisher not being married...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of people seem to think there  was some hostility out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting righteous) Well I can't really comment on what  "a lot of people" thought. I can  only tell you that we had a horrible  accident here and were all feeling  extremely traumatized and your  questions are a bit poorly timed.  We're in full on grieving mode right  now thank you very much Officer...  Randone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy Boyd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No easy Boyd! I got a best friend in  there in pieces. How about a little  sensitivity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyd storms off, goes and sits with Michael. Fisher stays with the cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all I wanted to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DOCTOR appears in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His situation is critical. He's asking  to speak to his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOTS of the guys eyeing each other nervously as Lois slo gets up and follows the Doctor into a treatment room. The guys move to the door, where they can see Lois, leani over the hospital bed, talking to Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam hooked up to dozens of wires, etc... Lois leans over to kiss him. Adam appears to be whisperin something to her.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GUYS
dialogues.text: Watching Adam speak to Lois... Nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lois has her ear to Adam's mouth. He is clearly speaking her. Lois is sobbing when... ALARMS GO OFF IN ADAM'S ROOM A MEDICAL TEAM rushes into the room. Adam is a v-tach --  Heart's not beating. The team injects medicine, defribula Lois watches in horror as her husband dies in front of he Finally a DOCTOR calls time of death. Lois collapses on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: WAITING ROOM
dialogues.text: The guys have witnessed Adam's death. Michael turns in ho Boyd, Fisher and Moore stare. Liz rushes to Fisher, throw her arms around him, overcome with grief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisher, Boyd, Moore and Michael eat eggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The need to know is clear. What did  Adam tell Lois? That's the name of  the game. What did Adam tell Lois?  What does Lois know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ball park sausages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want some breakfast meat, Michael.  Is that what you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clearly starting to  crack) Franco Harris has a flare for the  dramatic. The former Pittsburgh  Steeler running back, beat known for  "The Immaculate Reception," his  improbable sixty yard Ricochet  Reception. I say Ricochet Reception  has made a bold move on corporate  America. (inappropriately loud) Harris has lead a group of investors  in the purchase of the Park Sausage  Company. By taking on the challenge  of resurrecting Park's, Harris is  engaged in the equivalent of a sudden  death overtime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on a roll) He must take an open-field run to  profitability through excessive debt  large competitors and dwindling market  share. Before the clock runs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUSTOMERS are starting to pay notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screams) I KILLED MY BROTHER!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes on Michael. Boyd is immediately up trying to get Michael out of the booth. Casually, sweetly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Time to fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisher helps Boyd lift Michael, who is becoming more and  more frenzied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ran down my brother in cold blood.  Shame on me! Shame! Shame! Shame!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAITRESSES, COOKS and LATE NIGHT DINNERS stare, confused the HOWLING Michael is carried to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggling) Time to pay the man. "For if we  confess our sins he is faithful and  just, to forgive us our sins, and to  cleanse us from all unrighteousness."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisher and Boyd struggle with Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tipping Waitress) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She watches them haul Michael outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael thrashes wildly in the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Kill one man and you are a murderer!  Kill millions and you are a conqueror --  Kill all and you are a God!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael breaks free, starts running away. Boyd, Moore and Fisher give chase. Moore dives on Michael's back. Fisher  helps Moore hold Michael down while Boyd gets the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calming down) "The memory of the just is blessed  but the name of the wicked shall  rot."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyd is there with the car. They load Michael into the ba seat, climb in and disappear into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will get yourself together here  mister. Are you hearing me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's cracked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is not cracking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyd... What have we done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you ask me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is the question you asked me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you did. Now that is the  question! That is exactly the question  we should be asking ourselves. You  tell me Fisher. What have we done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know! I just want to get  married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you just said. Say it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to get married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly! Exactly my point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your fucking point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not talking to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to know what you are doing  here?! You are love pumping. You are  protecting all that is sacred and  beautiful and in sync with poetry  and sunsets and little newborn babies.  You are walking the walk. This is it  Fisher, the real stuff. You love  this woman. Love is second to nothing.  I love you. I love Moore. I love  Michael. This car is full of love,  and nothing -- absolutely nothing --  supersedes love, man. Nothing. We  will do what it takes. Whatever it  takes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyd takes Fisher's head in his hands and kisses him deep on the mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love does not lose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON Fisher, speechless.

dialogues.text: A Jewish ceremony. A hundred or so guests. A RABBI conduc the service. Lois sits in shock flanked by her boys. Michael, Fisher, Boyd and Moore stand in positions of hon up front. They're all eyeing each other. Michael starts emitting deep, uncontrollable, highly  inappropriate MOANS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy Michael.

dialogues.text: Liz and Fisher.

dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: We're goosed.

dialogues.text: I have no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I don't have that skill and if  I had to guess I would say that in  no way did she believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Goosed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goosed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goosed!

dialogues.text: Give me two more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Michael) Open sesame.

dialogues.text: Michael complies like a puppy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Boyd you're going to O.D. him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suck my ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never liked you Boyd. You're a  snaky little fuck. Always have been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't sweet lip me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael starts back in with the power sobbing. All eyes a on him. Guilty, uncomfortable silence. Michael's coming  unglued.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael? Do you have something to  tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael. Tell Lois that nothing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up Boyd! Michael?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet) Goosed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lois we were bad, we were very, very  bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lois please.

dialogues.text: She heads for the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you Boyd.

dialogues.text: The guys are freaking as she picks up the phone. Boyd loo at the kitchen knives. Fisher sees him, intervenes quickl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Lois... here's the deal. (beat) Adam was with a prostitute in Las  Vegas.

dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.text: And it wasn't the first time... He  had a thing about prostitutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. You.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finger in his ear) Do you hear buzzing fish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I got some kind of buzzing.  Like a zzzzzzzzzzzzzzzz thing just  chipping away in the back of my skull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, it's a nasty problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have another drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACKING SHOT down hallway into bedroom where Lois sleeps peacefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisher and Michael. Moore, drinking, just listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad used to bring home these sparklers  to me and Adam. Out back we'd light  'em up. The three of us. We'd hold  'em up to the sky and watch the  explosions of light. Sparks. And dad  would be all... "Get ready"... "watch  for it"... "here it comes," here  comes the "wahoo"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wahoo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sparkler would burn hot, then  hotter, then even hotter... and there  would be one moment of pure burn  when that little fucker would cook  just perfect. Perfect. It would only  last a second, but that second was  it. It was it. That's what dad had  us looking for... You get me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wahoo moment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my point! You see Man...  burning at his absolute. To see all  the forces just come together, just  right, you know, just in perfect  harmony. That's what I'm driving at.  You get me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been looking for that flash and  I look and I look and I can't find  it. And what if I already had it?  You know. My moment? What if it's  gone? And I never saw it? (finishes drink) You're getting married, man. That's  a fucking beautiful thing. Just a  beautiful thing. I just can't stop  breaking beautiful things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lois' bedroom. As Lois sleeps, Boyd softly enters the roo Moving in on the sleeping Lois, another couple of steps, looms over her, reaches his hand to her throat when, sudd Lois' eyes snap open. Boyd is startled. Lois grabs mace f her night stand and sprays Boyd in the face. He MOANS,  stumbles back. Lois leaps on him like a shark slamming a  side of beef. They go down hard on the floor and start fighting like wi animals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You picked the wrong woman mother- fucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Lois sinks her teeth into Boyd's balls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see for me it's over. Over baby.  I'm gonna turn myself in. After the  wedding of course. After the wedding.  Out of respect.

dialogues.text: I don't think that's a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said out of respect. Respect for  you Fisher. For you and your wedding  and your beautiful bride. There will  be no more rain. You see where I am  here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate it. I do, but... maybe  you ought to just ease up on yourself  a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No. No. This is my doing. You  see I'm gonna have my wahoo spark  for my own. For Lois and the kids,  for my brother, for Franco. I'm gonna  turn myself in. I am all that. I'm  gonna do it for sweet Lois.

dialogues.text: Boyd and Lois are choking the living shit out of each oth Boyd pulls back, swings with a left, Lois ducks, she swin a right cross to Boyds eye. He goes down. She jumps on hi Choking him like a mad dog. As Boyd struggles for air...

dialogues.text: Fisher checks his watch as Michael fumbles with his eight shot of Yukon Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I was to think... If I were to  think... No I mean I have thinked it  over... I have. And without putting  a lot of pressure on you I just...  Well I just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drunk-slow) Well if you do think about names...  Michael's a pretty good one... It's  done me all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (answers) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Okay. Here's the deal and it's a  good one. Lois is cool. It's a  pacified situation.

dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talking about Lois having relaxed  her anxiety. Only deal is... you  still got Michael there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.text: Good deal. Lois just wants to hear  it from Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That it was all an accident. She  wants to here it from Michael's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael drunkenly nods his head as if can hear the  conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it a little late?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on a sec. (turns) Lois, you sure you wouldn't rather  do this in the morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back into phone) She says now's the time. (quietly) I got a peace treaty thing happening  over here... let's get this over  with.

dialogues.text: Okay Michael, let's go. (helps him out) Upsy daisy big guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hammered) How about my Fatburger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on tough guy. Listen to me. (takes Michaels face  in his hands) You are going to tell Lois that it  was all an accident. Okay cowboy?  You got me?

dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's too drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greenpeace.

dialogues.text: Greenpeace?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael was having an affair with  Lois. That's what Michael and Adam  were arguing about in the parking  lot. Michael killed Adam in a jealous  rage. Lois broke it off with Michael,  he strangled her to death and then  shot himself in the head. (beat) Happens all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyd touches the painful scratches on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That Lois fought like a fucking  Comanche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON Fisher and Moore in stunned horror...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON BARRY MORRIS, mid-40's, attorney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see how this could have been  kept from you. The facts are quite  simple; last month Adam and Lois  changed their will. They requested  that you two, as a married couple,  be the Custodians of Record for their  estate including all properties,  cash holdings, security holdings  and... children. You are legal  custodians of the Brenn Trust.

dialogues.text: Liz and Fisher, flanked by Adam Jr. and Timmy, eyes wide, they sit across from the attorney, totally bazooka'd. The stare in horror at Morris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My god.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam and Lois were not terribly  prudent in terms of providing for  the possibility of the unforeseen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talking about Life insurance.  I'm talking about money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes money. Adam had a five hundred  thousand dollar Term Life Insurance  Policy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That means we get five hundred  thousand to help raise the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amazed) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, no. Adam was switching to  a Whole Life Policy, but re-scheduled  his medical exam... and failed to  make his last payment... so his Term  Life lapsed. So it's value is null  and void. (off Liz's horror) Now he did have a pension account,  worth another 150 thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relieved) Well, oh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a house. Valued at 350 thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where's that leave us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 150 plus 350... we still get 500  thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) No. Not even close. With property  values down, the house is worth  100,000 less than 450 he paid for  it. With three credit cards, the  minivan payments, and other  outstanding debts... Plus the Income  and Estate Taxes assessed on his  IRA... (punches his calculator) You'll get, oh... in the neighborhood  of, ah... 14,223 dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from me!

dialogues.text: I don't want your help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop kicking. Stop kicking!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breaking the tension) So. When is the wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow (at Fisher) We are getting married tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisher drives, Liz up front, Adam jr. and Timmy in the ba Everyone is shocked in silence. Fisher looks deathly ill, like he's about to vomit. He pulls the car over and gets  out.

dialogues.text: Fisher leans on the trunk, puking. Liz gets out to help h he starts crying. Liz is gentle and loving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay... It's okay baby. Cry for  Mama. Cry for Mama.

dialogues.text: No it's not okay. It's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cry for Boom Boom. It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sobbing) Liz we've got to cancel, we have to  put it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ice) Don't even.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you love me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you love me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of stupid question is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breaking down) Oh God. We. Liz. We. We. Killed a  woman. We...

dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (completely hysterical) Oh Liz. We. God. We, in Vegas. Michael  crushed her skull. She was dead.  There was nothing else to do. It was  an accident.
