dialogues.text: Who's dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prostitute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucked a prostitute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Michael did. It was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed a prostitute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, by accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God. You've got to call the police,  tell them it was an accident. Where  is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's in the desert. She's out in  the desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You left a dead prostitute out in  the desert? Alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not alone... She's... Boyd...  Oh God... He's gone nuts... He killed  Lois and Michael... it's all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! You stop right here. I don't  want to know anymore. I told you not  to do this Bachelor Party thing. You  were warned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No buts. I told you your friends  were Jackasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No buts. I've waited twenty-seven  years, twenty-seven years I have  focused and prepared to walk down  that aisle. I will not be derailed!  I will not be embarrassed! I will  not be denied! I am walking down  that aisle tomorrow come hell or  high fucking water!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz marches back to the car, gets in and slams the door.  Fisher just stares in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's pouring rain outside. Shots of guests dashing from their cars to the church. Fisher's parents with Adam Jr. and Timmy, looking overwhe Upstairs: Liz and her Bridesmaids help Liz get dressed.  Everyone looks depressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisher and Moore in tuxedos. Boyd enters, shuts the door. Fisher looks ill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, we're about two minutes out.  Moore, better take your position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moore looks at Fisher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chop chop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moore goes. A long tense BEAT between Fisher and Boyd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a situation that defies  judgement. We have acted and showed  courage that is not of a kind known  by most.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting really tired of your  bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got a warped thought process.  Your brain doesn't function properly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You care to add a little specification  to that slanderous accusation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snaps) I'm talking about some bad, bad,  very bad things. Bad things! Those  are bad fucking things!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine? Fine what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you say Kojak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious. I'm the serious one  here. I'm the one making the play.  I'm the Indian Runner. And I want my  money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The organ is playing. The guests are seated. Liz and her  father are waiting in the front hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told Boyd two fucking minutes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood money. Insurance dollars that  you have thus fucking far decided  not to tell me about at all. In no  way have you mentioned that money.  And I find that to be very very  offensive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (veins pulsing) And if you think you can fuck me,  don't. Cause I'm fucking insulated  Fisher. Protected. Backed up on  floppy. Do you get me? I want my  fucking money!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a prayer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a lifesaver. A lighthouse. Up  all night in the rain, in stormy  gale force wind, tornado and fucking  earthquakes. I stay lit for you. I  stay lit. I don't go dark. I never  go dark!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisher turns away. BOYD combusts. He leaps on Fisher with wild cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want that money!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyd and fisher fight like animals; choking, pounding,  mauling, a fight to the death. Fisher is losing, Boyd is  choking the life out of him, killing him. Fisher is going down, eyes rolling back, he's dying, until... CRASH. Boyd's head is caved in from behind. REVEAL Liz  wielding a big, heavy crucifix. Boyd slumps to the ground Fisher gasps for air. Boyd stirs. Liz beats him repeatedl with the crucifix until he's dead as a door knob. Fisher stunned. Liz tosses the cross. Miraculously, only one per droplet of blood has gotten on her wedding dress. She fli it off with her finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (composing herself) Here comes the bride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz gathers up her train and marches out. Fisher looks at Boyd, a bloody dead mess.

dialogues.speaker: THE WEDDING
dialogues.text: Fisher joins Moore at the alter. JUDGE TOWER smiles warml at Fisher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Boyd?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) Downstairs in the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Moore can ask, the ORGAN begins playing the WEDDIN MARCH. Liz starts down the aisle, escorted by her father, She smiles radiantly. Liz's father kisses her and gives her to Fisher. They sta before the Judge who starts talking. TIGHT ON Fisher. His head pounding. He hears none of what the Judge says until

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May we have the rings please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisher looks at Moore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moore opens the closet. Boyd falls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone waits patiently. Fisher is sweating. He looks at Liz who stares straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moore rolls Boyd over, checks every pocket, trying not to get blood on himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moore returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands the rings to the Judge, at which time, he, she,  Fisher and Liz all see blood on his white shirt cuff. The Judge looks at Moore. He pulls his jacket sleeve down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continues) These rings represent the commitment  Fisher and Liz make to each other on  the day. Fisher do you take Liz to  be your beloved wife, to respect,  honor and cherish till death do you  part?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz slides the ring on Fisher's finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz do you take Fisher to be your  beloved husband, to respect, honor  and cherish him till death do you  part?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisher slides the ring on Liz's finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I now pronounce you husband and wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisher kisses Liz. They turn to face their guests who app Liz cries tears of joy.

dialogues.speaker: WEDDING RECEPTION
dialogues.text: Liz drinks champagne and talks with her guests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisher and Moore load Boyd's body in the trunk of Fisher' car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He came to me early today, was talking  about money, insurance money. Said  he was gonna get what was his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he was the Brain Trust. Said  he was smarter than all of us. He  started reading "Atlas Shrugged,"  staring at himself in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he try to kiss you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All week long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisher slams the trunk closed.

dialogues.speaker: WEDDING RECEPTION
dialogues.text: Only a few guests remain. Fisher's parents watch the boys The caterers are cleaning up. Fisher and Liz sit alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kept saying he was protected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like if something happened to him,  he could still get us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like how?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. He could have told  someone. He could have, like in the  event of his death, somehow let  someone know where those bodies are  buried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only proof is those bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move the bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move the bodies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisher and Liz look up at a sweet OLD COUPLE, who talk at the same time, oblivious to each other. OLD MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just wanted to say  congratulations and  wish you great  happiness. Mazeltov. I  just did. I said  Malzeltov. You never  listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cheerleader smile) Thank you. Thank you. We will. Bye  bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Old Couple shuffles away. Fisher watches them go, he  suddenly breaks down, crying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... Liz... all I ever wanted, was  for you to be happy. I just wanted  to give you the wedding, the life  you always dreamed of... (sobs) ...I just love you so much... So  much...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat; unmoved) You and Moore move the bodies and  bury Boyd with them. In fact, put  Moore in the ground too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't tie up all the lose  ends it'll never be over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (horrified) No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You put him down or don't bother  coming back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you love me? DO YOU LOVE ME?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFF Fisher...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisher's car blasts past a road sign reading, "Las Vegas, 358 miles."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisher drives, Moore's in the passenger seat. They're sti in their tuxedos. Extreme silence. Fisher, almost in a tr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'm thinking about Michael's  Franco Harris fixation. You know how  Michael was always harping "Immaculate  Reception?" I've seen that play. A  lot of times... and I have to say  this... Franco was lucky. Flat out,  right place, right time. That's it.  He was where the ball bounced. You  get me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm saying it's luck. All luck. You  work your entire life, all the  training, focus, all the dedication,  all irrelevant. Where does the ball  bounce? My father spent his whole  life trying to start a company,  practiced every day, worked like a  dog, finally got enough money. He's  paid the dues, he's ready, does all  the market research, picks his shot --  "Pup Corn."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pup corn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, "Pup Corn." Doggie  treats. Little snacks for dogs. He's  figured it out. There is a hole in  the market and he's going to fill  it. Spends all out money, works  himself into not two but three heart  attacks getting this shit up. After  fifteen months, the big day arrives,  the first box of "Pup Corn" pops off  the belt. He comes running home with  that box, pulls us out of school. We  all pile into the living room, must  be fifty of us, and in comes  "Shelmer," our 8 year old mutt. "Here  Shelmer," my dad cries. He's got  that little fucking pup corn in his  hand, "Here girl." This dog will eat  anything, she eats rocks, anything.  She walk's up to my dad's hand, looks  down at the little pellet, licks it  once, turns around, walks out of the  room. Shelmer rejected the "Pup Corn."  Fifteen months of my dad's life,  right there. Not one dog ate Pup  Corn. Not one. Three months later,  "Pup Corn" shuts down. Chapter Eleven.  My father never got over it. Never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SILENCE hangs again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisher and Moore search for the graves of Tina and Ralph  with flashlights and shovels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it was over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move into a new area and start poking around. Nothin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was over by those rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again they search, prodding into earth with their shovels Nothing. Fisher stops digging, tired, he pauses, shines his light  around until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisher moves to a new spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. This rock is where I stood  when I said the prayer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts digging in front of the rock. The earth is soft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bingo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moore and Fisher quickly start to dig, until, finally, Mo shovel makes contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they dig some more.

dialogues.speaker: MOORE
dialogues.text: in the hole, passing the suitcases up to Fisher.

dialogues.speaker: FISHER
dialogues.text: loads the cases into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The suitcases are unloaded. Fisher and Moore dig a new gr Moore's back is to Fisher as he digs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been thinking about what you  said that day. The prayer. About  using this whole mess to bring out  the good in me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisher is directly above Moore, holding the shovel, looki down at the back of Moore's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think there's a lot of truth in  that. I'm gonna pursue some options.  I want to join that Big Brother thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly raises the  shovel over his head) That's a good one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a black one. A little black  brother. That's a big problem it  seems to me. Lack of racial  integration. That's a big one. You  think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moore looks up to... FISHER, tears running down his face, the shovel high abov his head, ready to bring it down hard onto Moore's skull. MOORE confused and then realization... CUT between Fisher above, poised to strike, Moore below, still and vulnerabl Their eyes locked for several beats. Finally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, Fisher lowers his shovel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you'd make an excellent Big  Brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back to work) That's what I'm thinking.

dialogues.speaker: THE GRAVE
dialogues.text: The cases are in the hole with Boyd's body. As Fisher and Moore re-fill the grave with dirt we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fisher drives, Moore rides shotgun, both mean are dirty,  sweaty and tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that ought to be about the end  of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON Fisher, staring deep into the road, a faint smil creeps on to his face...

dialogues.speaker: THE IMMACULATE RECEPTION
dialogues.text: The distorted but definitely recognizable image of Franco Harris running for his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's Franco Harris running for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Franco makes it into the Raider end zone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TOUCHDOWN FOR PITTSBURGH!  UNBELIEVABLE!

dialogues.speaker: FISHER
dialogues.text: Lost in his reverie, wakes up in a hair pin turn. The  speedometer reads 80. They run out of road. The car skids the shoulder, Fisher cranks the wheel, jumps the divider, into oncoming headlights. Fisher and Moore lit up bright.

dialogues.speaker: HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: Fisher's car SMASHES head-on into another car. IN SLOW MO Fisher and Moore are launched through the windshield in a IMPLOSION of glass and steel, flesh and blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the sounds of SCRUBBING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON Liz, on her hands and knees, scrubbing around th toilet of what is clearly a filthy kids bathroom; soiled  jockey shorts, Tonka trucks, mess everywhere. O.S. we hear voices outside. Liz gets up off her knees,  brushes a piece of hair from her sweaty face and peers ou the bathroom window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay let's try it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam Jr. and Timmy, in ill-fitted Cub Scout uniforms, rec the "Scout Laws." TIMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A scout is thrifty,  saves for the future.  A scout is clean, he  keeps his body...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see the salutes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Timmy snaps out a fine salute. Adam balances on one crutc to salute but looses balance and falls flat on his face. starts SCREAMING. REVEAL Fisher, in a wheelchair, both legs amputated above the knee. He leans over, trying to help Adam Jr. up and h wheel chair tips over. Fisher falls on top of Adam Jr. wh SCREAMS even louder, flailing arms and legs like a turtle its back. REVEAL Moore, in an electric wheel chair he operated with mouthpiece. As he is paralyzed from the neck down, he's n help at all. Timmy suddenly snaps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Adam Jr.) Shut up! Shut the fuck up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, it's okay.

dialogues.speaker: THE BATHROOM WINDOW
dialogues.text: Liz watches the pathetic chaos that is her life with the  dull lifeless eyes of a concentration camp prisoner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Timmy SHUT UP! Help your brother!  ADAM! Let him help you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON Liz as her mouth slowly opens in an anguished SI SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: OUT THE WINDOW
dialogues.text: Adam Jr. gets back on his feet, with the begrudging help Timmy. As Fisher struggles to hoist himself up, back in h wheelchair...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember a scout is helpful! A scout  doesn't scream in the face of  adversity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, O.S. from the bathroom, Liz WAILS. Fisher looks at the window... LONG BEAT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the boys) Okay, let's skip to the Scout's  Oath... ADAM JR. & TIMMY On my honor, I will do my best...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys recite the "Scout's Oath" as Liz's deep, heaving wailing SOBS grow in intensity O.C. ADAM JR. & TIMMY ...to do my duty to God and my  country... To obey the Scout Law, to  help other people at all times...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLOWLY PULL OFF Fisher, Moore and the kids... ADAM JR. & TIMMY To keep myself physically strong,  mentally awake, and morally straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRANE UP, past Liz at the window, out of the yard, over t house, WIDER to reveal the surrounding track-like homes,  housing track-like families, with track-like nightmares a Liz's plaintiff wails echo the communal despair of the hu village.
